In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function named `wrap_string` that wraps the input string to fit within a specified `text_width`. If not provided, `text_width` defaults to 10 characters.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_lines = Vector{String}()
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word '$word' exceeds the maximum text width.")
        end
        
        if isempty(wrapped_lines) || length(join(wrapped_lines, " "))) + length(word) <= text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, word)
        else
            push!(wrapped_lines, "\n" * word)
        end
    end
    
    return join(wrapped_lines, " ")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output:

```
Lorem ipsum dolor 
sit amet, consectetur 
adipiscing elit.
```
